title: 97/216/EC: Commission Decision of 26 March 1997 concerning protection measures relating to classical swine fever in the Netherlands and repealing Decision 97/122/EC (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 26 March 1997 concerning protection measures relating to classical swine fever in the Netherlands and repealing Decision 97/122/EC (Text with EEA relevance) (97/216/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The Netherlands shall not send the following to other Member States:
(a) live pigs,
(b) boar semen.

1. The Netherlands shall, at eight day intervals, present data on the Classical Swine Fever situation in the format indicated in the Annex.
2. This Decision shall be reviewed before 15 April 1997.
The Member States shall amend the measures they apply to trade so as to bring them into compliance with this Decision. They shall immediately inform the Commission thereof.
This Decision is addressed to Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 26 March 1997.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
